title: Shia LaBeouf reveals he wrestled with Tom Hardy on the set of Lawless
text:
Shia LaBeouf has dispelled rumours he “knocked out” Tom Hardy on the set of Lawless.

The actor, 33, said the pair would often wrestle while on set but the claims about him flooring the Mad Max star are untrue.

Speaking on YouTube channel series Hot Ones, by First We Feast, LaBeouf said: “Yeah it’s a bunch of bulls***. We used to wrestle all the time. He was a big f***ing person, especially then, he was getting ready for Bane.

“My girlfriend at the time was over at my house…he runs into the room and the girl I was with at the time…covered up and ran into the kitchen.

He added: “He picked me up, and I had nothing on, so I’m naked, on his shoulder in the hallway, we’re wrestling around.

“We were inching over to where the stairs were and he fell down the stairs. He wound up hurting his back, so for the rest of the shoot he told everyone I knocked him out but that wasn’t the case. We were having some weird, cutie wrestling match.”

Hard men: Jason Clarke, Tom Hardy, and Shia LaBeouf in Lawless ((The Weinstein Company)) More

Hardy, 42, has previously spoken highly of LaBeouf, praising him as an actor in an interview with Esquire magazine.

He told the publication: “Shia has the ability to land scene after scene that builds a reality from utter fantasy. We know the robots aren’t really there. They just aren’t. When I watch Shia, they are.”

LaBeouf was speaking to Evans ahead of the release of his film – Honey Boy.

Honey Boy is a semi-autobiographical movie about LaBeouf’s relationship with his father Jeffrey Craig.

LaBeouf, who wrote the screenplay, stars in the film as character James Lort. FKA Twigs and Lucas Hedges also feature in the movie, which is due to be released in the US on November 8.
